channel.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: us
channel.description: Get the latest news online at Major Digest, the top online news resource for the most reliable news sources. Stay informed about the world around you!

image.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: us

item.title: New multistate lottery game expected in 2026 could make you a millionaire
item.description: Sure, winning a record-breaking Powerball jackpot may be cool, but what about $1 million a year for the rest of your life?
item.dc:creator: Addy Bink, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: How does 'doomscrolling' actually affect us? Experts weigh in
item.description: While it may feel relaxing to put one's mind on pause and endless scroll the feed of a favorite app, experts are urging people to beware of certain warning signs.
item.dc:creator: Jeremy Tanner, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Federal judge rules Trump can’t require citizenship proof on the federal voting form
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — President Donald Trump’s request to add a documentary proof of citizenship requirement to the federal voter registration form cannot be enforced, a federal judge ruled Friday. U.S. District Judge Colleen Kollar-Kotelly in Washington, D.C.
item.dc:creator: ALI SWENSON and NICHOLAS RICCARDI, Associated Press, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Multiple people have been arrested in Michigan in a Halloween weekend attack plot, FBI director says
item.description: DEARBORN, Mich. (AP) — Multiple people who had been allegedly plotting a violent attack over the Halloween weekend were arrested Friday in Michigan, FBI Director Kash Patel said in a social media post. The law enforcement effort was focused on suburban Detroit.
item.dc:creator: MIKE HOUSEHOLDER and ERIC TUCKER, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs transferred to New Jersey prison to serve 4-year prostitution-related sentence
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Sean “Diddy” Combs has been transferred to a prison in New Jersey to serve out the remainder of his four-year prison sentence on prostitution-related charges.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Court says Border Patrol official won't have to brief judge on Chicago-area immigration sweeps
item.description: CHICAGO (AP) — An appeals court ruled in favor of the Trump administration Friday and stopped a judge from trying to get daily updates from a Border Patrol official about the government's immigration crackdown in the Chicago area. The court said the order from U.S.
item.dc:creator: CHRISTINE FERNANDO, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: Missing 13-year-old Louisana girl found in Pittsburgh basement
item.description: During questioning, investigators learned he had been with the girl at the Greyhound Bus Station in Baton Rouge earlier that week.
item.dc:creator: Trinity Velazquez, NewsNation

item.title: EA reports decrease in sales, lose content creators amid buyout
item.description: EA has reported a 13% dip in overall sales of $1.81 billion despite significant gains in its Madden NFL and Sports FC franchises.
item.dc:creator: Cher Hwang, NewsNation

item.title: Judge orders arrest of ex-Green Beret tied to failed Venezuela raid after court no-show
item.description: TAMPA, Fla. (AP) — A federal judge in Tampa has ordered the arrest of a former Green Beret accused of plotting to invade Venezuela in 2020 after he failed to show up to court for a hearing on whether he should be taken back into custody for violating the conditions of his pre-trial release.
item.dc:creator: CURT ANDERSON and JOSHUA GOODMAN, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Blood pressure medication recalled over potential carcinogen: What to know
item.description: Nearly 590,000 bottles of blood pressure drugs have been recalled over concerns that they may contain a potentially carcinogenic chemical that exceeds the “acceptable intake limit.
item.dc:creator: Michael Bartiromo, Fox 5

item.title: Trump urged GOP-led states to redraw US House districts. Now other states also are gerrymandering
item.description: President Donald Trump's call for Republicans to redraw U.S. House districts ahead of next year's election has triggered an unusual outbreak of mid-decade gerrymandering among both Republican- and Democratic-led states.
item.dc:creator: DAVID A. LIEB, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: When will SNAP EBT cards be reloaded? Delays still possible despite judges' rulings
item.description: Just hours before the looming deadline, two judges ruled Friday that the federal government must continue funding SNAP during the government shut down. However, those expecting food assistance on Nov. 1 may still see delays.
item.dc:creator: Alix Martichoux, KRON4

item.title: Air traffic controller shortages lead to broader US flight delays as shutdown nears one-month mark
item.description: Continued staffing shortages in air traffic control facilities are causing delays at airports as the government shutdown nears the one-month mark.
item.dc:creator: Rio Yamat, Associated Press, KPRC 2

item.title: Fox News True Crime Newsletter: Bryan Kohberger’s cash clash, Luigi Mangione's street cred, DC sniper's reveal
item.description: Stay up to date with the Fox News True Crime Newsletter, which brings you the latest cases ripped from the headlines, from crime to courts, legal and scandal.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: California animal shelter rescues nearly 100 small pets from single home
item.description: The organization took in 31 mice and 63 hamsters, some of which are pregnant and expected to give birth soon.
item.dc:creator: Lily Dallow, NewsNation

item.title: Fast chargers are expanding quickly, but American EV drivers still fear running out of juice
item.description: KENT, Conn. (AP) — For most Americans, there’s less reason than ever to worry about finding chargers to fuel up an electric vehicle. But charging worries remain a top hesitation for potential buyers, second only to sticker shock. Those concerns linger even as fast chargers multiply.
item.dc:creator: M.K. WILDEMAN, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Republicans battling behind scenes over funding SNAP during shutdown
item.description: Cracks are forming in the Senate GOP conference over whether benefits under the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) should be allowed to lapse this weekend.
item.dc:creator: Alexander Bolton, WGN 9

item.title: Cannabis use may boost tobacco addiction risk in young Americans, study finds
item.description: New research from UC San Diego found that cannabis use among youth may be responsible for 13% of new cases of regular tobacco use in the US, suggesting that cannabis use should be considered a major risk factor for later tobacco addiction.
item.dc:creator: Amber Coakley, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: DC Mayor Bowser says residents will receive SNAP, WIC benefits in November
item.description: Washington, D.C., Mayor Muriel Bowser (D) on Thursday said the city will fund the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) and the separate program for Women, Infants, and Children (WIC) for the month of November amid the government shutdown.
item.dc:creator: Ashleigh Fields, WGN 9

item.title: Photos: Trumps host Halloween event at White House
item.description: President Donald Trump and first lady Melania Trump hosted trick-or-treaters on Thursday in a Halloween celebration that has become a fun White House tradition.
item.dc:creator: The Hill, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Why some schools have been spooked out of Halloween
item.description: Religion, politics and student participation are all among the reasons some schools have abandoned Halloween celebrations that put candy-filled children in bulky costumes in classrooms.
item.dc:creator: Lexi Lonas Cochran, WFLA, NBC

item.title: A 3rd teenager is indicted for the killing of a congressional intern in Washington
item.description: A third teenager has been arrested and charged with the killing of a congressional intern in the nation's capital, a crime that President Donald Trump cited when he announced a law enforcement surge in Washington.
item.dc:creator: AUDREY McAVOY, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Hollywood producer sentenced to 146 years for killing 2 women, multiple rapes
item.description: A Hollywood producer was sentenced to 146 years in prison for the murders of two women and for sexually assaulting seven others.
item.dc:creator: Vivian Chow, NewsNation

item.title: Investigators serve search warrants to find California girl Melodee Buzzard
item.description: Video obtained by NewsNation's Ashley Banfield appeared to show Ashlee Buzzard removing missing person posters that had been placed on her property.
item.dc:creator: Travis Schlepp, NewsNation

item.title: National Guard in each state is ordered to create 'quick reaction forces' trained in civil unrest
item.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Military leaders have ordered the National Guard in every state to develop a “quick reaction force” of troops trained to deal with civil disturbances and riots that can be ready to deploy with just hours' notice, the latest indication of longer-term Trump administration plans to mo
item.dc:creator: KONSTANTIN TOROPIN, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Louisiana deputy accused of orchestrating inmate-on-inmate attack
item.description: Danny C. Taylor, 40, is facing serious charges after allegedly directing an inmate to assault another inmate.
item.dc:creator: Erykah Agers, NewsNation

item.title: Nationals finalizing hire of 33-year-old Blake Butera as manager, AP source says
item.description: The Washington Nationals are finalizing a deal to hire 33-year-old Blake Butera as manager, according to a person with knowledge of the situation. The person spoke to The Associated Press on Thursday on condition of anonymity because nothing had been announced.
item.dc:creator: NOAH TRISTER, Associated Press, KTLA 5

item.title: Pentagon orders 'quick reaction force' of 500 troops per state: Reports
item.description: The National Guard is building a “quick reaction force” (QRF) of some 23,500 troops trained in crowd control and civil disturbance that can be ready to deploy to U.S. cities by early next year, according to a leaked memo reported by multiple outlets Wednesday.
item.dc:creator: Ellen Mitchell, WGN 9

item.title: Media coalition sues Tennessee prison officials to get more access to executions
item.description: A coalition of news organizations including The Associated Press is suing Tennessee’s top prisons official and a warden, alleging state execution protocols unconstitutionally limit the media's access and hamper thorough and accurate reporting.
item.dc:creator: ADRIAN SAINZ, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: MAP: See the number of SNAP participants in San Diego County as benefit lapse looms
item.description: Over 40 million Americans could lose access to federal food assistance Saturday if the government shutdown continues into November.
item.dc:creator: Jeremy Tanner, Fox 5

item.title: Man deported to Laos despite court order blocking his removal, attorneys say
item.description: NEW ORLEANS (AP) — Immigration officials have deported a father living in Alabama to Laos despite a federal court order blocking his removal from the U.S. on the grounds he has a claim to citizenship, the man's attorneys said Tuesday. U.S. District Judge Shelly Dick last week ordered U.S.
item.dc:creator: JIM MUSTIAN and JACK BROOK, Associated Press, ABC 4
